paper_metadata.title: Hereditary Breast and Ovarian Cancer in Families from Southern Italy (Sicily)—Prevalence and Geographic Distribution of Pathogenic Variants in BRCA1/2 Genes
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Most of the Sicilian cancer patients harboring this PV had breast cancer (19 subjects) and one only ovarian cancer.
Most of the Sicilian cancer patients harboring this PV had breast cancer (19 subjects) and one only ovarian cancer.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on family segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was found in 12 families.
key_quotes: The second most frequent PV, found in 12 families and involving a total of 49 subjects (10.1%), including 20 cancer patients (12 probands and 8 family members), is named BRCA2-1466delT (HGVS nomenclature: c.1238del; p.Leu413fs).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among cancer patients harboring this PV, 3 subjects had breast cancer, 1 ovarian cancer and 1 both primary ovarian and breast cancer.
Among cancer patients harboring this PV, 3 subjects had breast cancer, 1 ovarian cancer and 1 both primary ovarian and breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on family segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was found in families from North-Western Sicily.
key_quotes: A PV, mainly observed in some families from North-Western Sicily (16 individuals, 5 of which cancer patients) belonging to the geographical area that includes the city of Trapani and neighboring areas, is named BRCA2-6310del5 (HGVS nomenclature: c.6082_6086del; p.Glu2028fs).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among cancer patients harboring this PV, 5 individuals had female breast cancer, 2 male breast cancer and one both primary ovarian and breast cancer.
Among cancer patients harboring this PV, 5 individuals had female breast cancer, 2 male breast cancer and one both primary ovarian and breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on family segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was found in families from North-western Sicily.
key_quotes: Furthermore, another PV named BRCA2-6079del4 (HGVS nomenclature: c.5851_5854del; p.Ser1951fs) was also detected in some families from North-western Sicily (17 individuals, including 8 cancer patients) belonging to the geographical area that includes the cities of Palermo and Trapani and neighboring areas.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical Features of Germline BRCA1/2 PV Carriers

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
